name: fish tagine
ingredients: 4 fillets of deboned grey dorade (or other white fish)
70 g of onion cut in half
300 g of carrots cut into 2 cm pieces
300 g of fennel cut into small pieces

Chermoula: 1 garlic clove, 15 g of fresh parsley leaves, 10 g of fresh coriander leaves, 1 pinch of ground cumin, 30 g of lemon juice, 55 g of olive oil, 5 pinches of salt, 2 pinches of freshly ground pepper, 1 tsp of ground four-spice, 1 tsp of sweet paprika
steps: Prepare the chermoula: Chop the garlic, parsley, coriander, and cumin. Add the lemon juice, 30g of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend. Pour over the dorade fillets and set aside (the fish is often placed in the Varoma for steaming).
Prepare the broth: Chop the onion. Add the four-spice, paprika, and 15g of olive oil. Saut√© for 4 minutes.
Add the carrots, fennel, and 600g of water. Cook for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare the couscous: mix the couscous grains with the remaining water, salt, and oil. Let it swell. Transfer to the steaming tray and add the chickpeas.
Set up the fish (in the Varoma) and the steaming tray. Steam (about 10 minutes).
Serve the dorade, vegetables, and couscous immediately.
